meanings.definition: The beliefs, methods, or practices characteristic of academics.
meanings.sent1: In her essay, she discussed the importance of academicism in research.
meanings.sent2: His academicism led him to pursue a career in teaching.
meanings.sent3: The cat's academicism in hunting mice was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her academicism shone brightly in the field of mathematics.
meanings.sent5: The academicism of the library made it a perfect study spot.

meanings.definition: Excessive emphasis on formal learning or scholarship.
meanings.sent1: The school's academicism sometimes made students feel overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: Her academicism often made her miss out on fun activities.
meanings.sent3: The academicism of the marathon runner in training was admirable.
meanings.sent4: His academicism in music practice was like a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent5: The academicism of the book club made reading a serious affair.

meanings.definition: Adherence to traditional academic standards or conventions.
meanings.sent1: His academicism in following the rules made him a model student.
meanings.sent2: The academicism of the professor was evident in his strict grading.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's academicism in swimming competitions was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her academicism in etiquette made her stand out in social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The academicism of the museum preserved history for future generations.
